newsitem.title: INDIA: Bombay bourse clears fund to avoid trade defaults.
newsitem.headline: Bombay bourse clears fund to avoid trade defaults.

text.p: The Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) said on Wednesday it has approved a separate fund to avoid trade defaults and safeguard investors.
"The main objective of the fund is to make temporary refundable advance to the members for tiding over a temporary mismatch in his fund flow," the BSE president M.G. Damani was quoted as saying.
The Stock Exchange Brokers' Contingency Fund has an initial corpus of 95.1 million rupees and a maximum advance limit of five million rupees, the BSE said in a statement.
